definition[0]: a tall upright round post used as a support for a roof or bridge
example[0]: Eight massive stone pillars supported the roof.
definition[1]: a tall upright round post, usually made of stone, put up to remind people of an important person or event
definition[2]: a very important part of a system of beliefs or ideas
example[1]: One of the pillars of a civilized society must be that everyone has equal access to the legal system.
